subject: Declaration of Award under Section. 3G of NH Act; 1956; for Structures falling within the RoW of road projects.
text: HR <iv WTTHTi gfetaorut 844 Phone 91-11-25074100/25074200 (s* @ae- ak rrTHRf AATC4) Y44 / Fax : 91-11-25093507 25093514 M National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways) v-5 &a 6, Waer-10, EReT , 78 feat-110075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, New Delhi-110075 NHAI/Policy Guidelines/Land Acquisition/2019 No.7.1.57 dated the lJune, 2019 [Decision taken on file No. NHAILA/Structures/2019] Sub: Declaration of Award under Section: 3G of NH Act, 1956, for Structures falling within the RoW of road projects. It is stated that once the MoRTGH has notified any land for acquisition for a road project or associated facilities, the CALA is duty-bound under law to determine the compensation for the subject land and the assets attached thereto or standing thereon as on the date of issue of Section 3-A Notification. These assets may be in the form of built-up structures, fruit trees,normal tree orcany other such asset. Generally, CALA is required to the valuation of such assets carried out from the respective  competent authorities e.g: from the PWD or approved valuers in respect Of structures; from an Horticulture Officertn respectage fruit trees, from the Forest Officer in respect of general trees etc. In case valuation is done through the private  certified approved agency, the same is required to be vetted by the appropriate State Govt: agency: 2 Section 3D of the NH Act; 1956 provides declaration of acquisition and as per sub-section (2) of Section 3D, on the publication of the declaration under Section 3D, the land shall vest absolutely in the Central Govt: free from all encumbrances 3_ Section 3E of the NH Act; 1956 further provides power to take possession of the land: A5 per sub-section (1) of Section 3E where ay land has vested rin the Central Govt. under sub-section (2) of Section 3D, and the amount determined by the CALA under Section 3G with respect to such land has been deposited bby the Central Govt. the CALA may direct the owner as well as any other person who may be in possession of such land to surrender or deliver possession thereof: As such, as statutory provisions, to take possession emanates once award under Section 3G is declared and payment is deposited with CALA 4_ It has, however, come to notice that award in respect of land and assets attached to land under acquisition are being separately declared by CALAs andtin most of the cases, supplementary awards are declared by CALA in respect of assets. This is distinct from the legal leeway available for declaration of awards in part; This has been viewed seriously as this practice not only weakens the statutory right to take possession of the land under Section 3E but also shall be not legally tenable in case of disputes in any court of law. 5_ Keeping above in view; all PDs are hereby directed to pursue valuation of assets attached to land under  acquisition on priority SO that CALA can issue a consolidated Award under Section 36, for both land and assets thereon: All ROs RT RT NHAI get power per
